intro: Wendlandia sibuyanensis, commonly known as the Sibuyan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in montane forests and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
